intro: Lycium barbinodum, commonly known as the desert枸杞 or hairy boxthorn, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through its deep root system and ability to store water in its succulent leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lycium barbinodum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing food for wildlife in its native habitat.
